title: The Underground Poneglyph Contains Arabasta's History
theoryText: The Poneglyph discovered in the underground ruins might tell Arabasta's ancient history or contain information related to the ancient weapon Pluton, which is known to be connected to Arabasta.
author: Anime & Manga Stack Exchange User

spoilerStatus.spoilerDescription: References Pluton which is revealed later in the Arabasta Arc

statusReason: This episode and Poneglyph are confirmed to be non-canon filler content, so the Poneglyph has no actual significance to the story.

title: The Poneglyph Was Hidden by Moving the Capital
theoryText: Some fans theorized that this Poneglyph might contain Void Century information that was deliberately hidden when Arabasta moved its capital city to a different location, leaving these ruins buried in the desert.
author: Stack Exchange Community Discussion

spoilerStatus.spoilerDescription: Based only on information available in this episode

statusReason: Episode 102 is filler and the Poneglyph shown is non-canon.

title: The Poneglyph Inscription Says 'Machine'
theoryText: A fan attempted to translate the Poneglyph text using Google Translate and claimed it only said 'machine,' suggesting it might not have intentional meaning or could relate to an ancient weapon or device.
author: Stack Exchange Commenter

spoilerStatus.spoilerDescription: Speculation about this specific filler episode

statusReason: The Poneglyph script in One Piece is fictional and cannot be accurately translated by real-world language tools. Additionally, this is filler content.

title: This Could Be the Rio Poneglyph
theoryText: Some fans speculated that the Poneglyph discovered in Episode 102 could be the Rio Poneglyph - the one Poneglyph that tells the complete truth of what occurred during the Void Century. The theory suggests it was hidden in the Arabasta desert for safekeeping.
author: Quora User Discussion

spoilerStatus.spoilerDescription: References the Rio Poneglyph concept which is revealed much later in the series

statusReason: This episode is confirmed filler and non-canon, so this Poneglyph has no significance to the actual One Piece storyline.

title: Toei Added Poneglyph as Foreshadowing
theoryText: The anime production team (Toei Animation) deliberately included a Poneglyph in this filler episode to foreshadow their importance in the story, particularly the canon Poneglyph that appears later in the Arabasta Arc in the Tomb of the Kings.
author: Fan Community Consensus

spoilerStatus.spoilerDescription: References the canon Poneglyph appearance in Episode 107

statusReason: This is a reasonable explanation for why Toei would include such an important story element in a filler episode - to introduce the concept to anime viewers before its canon appearance.
